posts.name: Max Piroumian
posts.cooked: I’m trying to run the drivetrain on my robot but the left side just clicks whenever I try to run the motor. Eventually, it moves for a little bit and gets stuck again. If you look closely, motor 3 jerks when that clicking happens. Does anyone know what the issue is? Here’s a video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eFodPjNDleqTRYNEL5FE7w9bZTjIoNcV/view?usp=drivesdk

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
Obvious ones:

With power off, spin the wheels. Do they move smoothly?

Pull the motors out of the gearbox. Do all of them spin in the same direction?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.custom_user_title: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.name: Justin Montois
posts.cooked:
My money is on motors fighting each other.

Motors Fighting -115 Something in code +200 Something jamming the Gearbox +350

Place your bets

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: 3015 | Drive Coach | FRC Top 25 | Tactical Genius

posts.custom_user_title: 3015 | Drive Coach | FRC Top 25 | Tactical Genius

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
I’d be thinking a key fell out and is bouncing around. When you hand-spin the wheels, have someone listening to the gearbox for rattling.

Motors fighting each other is also a decent option, but they don’t suddenly start working together then start fighting again, in my experience.

posts.name: Ezra
posts.cooked: Also might be one just not turning at the right speed (code/motor problem)
